@onichols-pivotal in answer to your other quesiton, github auto enables it https://help.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/configuring-automated-security-updates#supported-repositories

FWIW, I didn't always check in Gemfile.lock files, but due to the flakiness
of our ruby-based pub tools, I've started following the advice of Sean and
Michael - checking in the lockfile keeps things more stable.

@rhoughton-pivot given that we now have a `geode-gfsh` module should this be closed?
@demery-pivotal please review

> Can we change this to default to squash-merge instead?

If GitHub provided such an option, I agree that would be nicer way to solve the problem.  However to the best of my knowledge, GitHub does not currently offer that level of control.  Please refer to https://help.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/configuring-commit-squashing-for-pull-requests for details on what is possible to configure.

Because I deleted the version of the windows image with the updated
GCEWindowsAgent

closing this PR - there is a new one that provides a permanent fix
Opened up another ticket as an improvement once this PR is merged: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GEODE-7624
The only distributed test failure I see is an instance of GEODE-7617, which is a known flaky test, and not related to this PR.

Closing this PR, superseded by newer work.
When you merged, did you mean to downgrade to Spring 4?  I don't think we want that.
Closing this out in favor of doing an RFC.  We can still refer to the ideas proposed in this PR.
I don't believe this approach will work for JDK9+.  The gc logging properties have changed.
Let's close this out in favor of #4496.

Hmmm, take a look at this for a starting point?

https://github.com/metatype/incubator-geode/commit/d20cf0c79f78618d7b6eb53bed800fd748f4a82e

botched merge
Reverting the deprecation since we support upgrading from any minor to another minor, and this name change would break that

Note that this commit will not be included in the 1.11.0 tag or release.
@jmelchio
I think the `atLeast()` failures are due to https://github.com/awaitility/awaitility/issues/148.
I need to run lucene backward compatibility tests
@jmelchio
Ahem... Spotless.
As this is still being discussed on the dev list, please leave your comments on the dev list, and do not merge this PR unless the is consensus and a successful vote on the dev list.
The  lucene backward compatibility regression passed. Precheckin also passed.

@bschuchardt I am sure there are many good candidates to add to the `GeodeGlossary` I'm taking the "build it, and they will come approach" ;)

and ðŸ¤ž that StressTests will run this time
Based on dev list discussion, it sounds like the preference is to leave all 3 merge options enabled, therefore this PR is unneeded.
@jmelchio

I don't think I follow the bind address logic.  Do you know why we throw an exception in one case of unresolvable host name but not the other?  IMHO it seems like we should expect DNS to be unreliable and not assume misconfiguration as the only cause of unresolv-ability.

I believe that local host name check is pretty old behavior. However, it could bite us in any orchestrated deployment where DNS setup is delayed until after a service is running. Iâ€™d suggest addressing that issue in another ticket and letting this one through as is to correct the bug.
Rolling back the jq update for a followup pr, there are extensive API changes.  Also waiting for an awaitility release.
so @metatype you'd like to see the whole `if (checkLoopback)` block removed entirely right? Yeah, I don't have insight into why we want to do that (conditional) prechecking

If IP of locator from initialLocators list is updated, we have problem eventualy, because updated LocatorAddress is overwritten with old LocatorAddress locator from initialLocators list (in procedure updateLocatorList). If we do not want additional filtering, possible solution is to update initialLocators list.
the only part that needs to consider regionAware is in the LocatorClusterManagementService (the main pipeline). All other changes are test changes.
@BalaKaza
I have another PR coming that has more changes, think it is actually better if I hold off on these changes until that PR to avoid merge problems. I do like them though.
@upthewaterspout we could go with `NotShunnable` or something similar as that is the behavior we are indicating...  I'm open to suggestions
@pivotal-eshu have you had a chance to look at this?

> any ideas on how to make break the doPutOrCreate method down?

There are several problems with the doPutOrCreate method, both in terms of its complexity and size, and the fact that it always returns true, even if the update does not actually succeed. Allowing the method to return false in the even that all three calls to `LocalRegion.basicUpdate` fail results in several DUnit tests failing, so it might be necessary to create a separate Geode ticket for a refactor/fix of this method.

The behavior as described:
`
list gateways --senders=false --receivers=false and any combination using "one true and one false" will be like running list gateways.`

sounds odd to me... if one is true and the other false, i would expect it to run similar to list gateways --sender=true or --receivers=true depending on which is true...

Solution with HostAddress class is to use DNS query before contacting each locator, which is according to current implementation intentionally avoided. This the reason I would prefer last proposed solution.

I like where this is headed...
had a couple failures running locally with this PR
`org.apache.geode.internal.cache.persistence.PersistentRecoveryOrderDUnitTest`
`-- testWaitingMemberList
-- testRevokeAHostBeforeInitialization`
closing since #4586 was merged, but it would have been nice to clean up the rest of the file while that was added...

If I understand your proposal correctly, you would like just to remove usage of getSocketInetAddressNoLookup() method, and always use getSocketInetAddress() which then perform DNS resolving (create the new instance of InetSocketAddress)
Submitting a bug against DistributedAckRegionCCEDUnitTest > testClearOnNonReplicateWithConcurrentEvents this is a product issue.

> The behavior as described:
> ` list gateways --senders=false --receivers=false and any combination using "one true and one false" will be like running list gateways.`
> 
> sounds odd to me... if one is true and the other false, i would expect it to run similar to list gateways --sender=true or --receivers=true depending on which is true...

I think that with the change suggested by @jujoramos it will have more sense to you. The parameters `--senders` and `--receivers` are used to indicate "show only senders" and "show only receivers" respectively. So better if I rename them :)
